result.execSummary:
The defendant Marvin Louis Thomas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Resisting An Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant to provide DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge.  Defendant to provide DNA by 5:00 p.m. on 6/1/2022.

Court waives all nonmandatory cots, fees and surcharges.

Credit for 25 days time served on count 1. Time served disposition.
Credit for 37 days credit time served on count 2.  Time served dispositoin.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marvin Louis Thomas

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Marvin Louis Thomas in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Defendant Marvin Louis Thomas in custody.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for plea and sentencing.   Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.  State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. 
Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 
Court is in receipt of the; Plea Questionnaire, Addendum and WIS JI- Criminal/ Elements of the Offense.




AS TO COUNTS 1 and 2:
PLEA HEARING HELD:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  
Defendant advised that if he is not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. 
Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. State consents to the Jury Waiver. Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
Court ordered a DNA sample and advised defendant of applicable surcharge. 

SENTENCING HEARING HELD FOR COUNTS 1  AND 2: Statements by the State, Defense counsel and Defendant.
COURT ORDERED Defendant to serve 25 DAYS in the House of Correction for count 1 and 37 DAYS in the House of Correction for count 2.
Credit for 25 DAYS time served on count 1 and 37 DAYS credit time served on count 2. (TIME SERVED DISPOSITION).   

* No fine due to inability to pay. 
* Defenant to provide DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge. Defendant to provide DNA by 5:00pm on 06/01/2022.
* Restitution set a zero.
*Court waives all non-mandatory costs, fees, and surcharges. All mandatory costs, fees, and surcharges are payable in 12 months or civil judgment/tax intercept. 
* Appellate Rights given.  Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.  State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. 
Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 
Court is in receipt of the; Plea Questionnaire, Addendum and WIS JI- Criminal/ Elements of the Offense.
Court finds defendant knowingly and willingly WAIVED her/his right to have an in person hearing and proceeds Remotely. 




AS TO COUNTS 3 and 4  - Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Charges DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

Case set today for a plea and sentencing. Due to the Court bring in trial, case was rescheduled. Parties were notified of the next court date via email.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Case in court for status conference. Defedant's appearance is waived.  Defense requests resolution date.  Case adjourned to Branch 30. Plea/sentencing hearing is scheduled on May 25, 2022 at 9:30am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
All previous bail conditions remain in full force and effect.

Attorney Sam Obscherning in court, defendant Marvin Louis Thomas not in court, in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means for .

Defendant's Motion to Modify Bail, filed.

Defendant Marvin Louis Thomas in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Defendant Marvin Louis Thomas in custody.  Matthew Richard Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Marvin Louis Thomas appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/76b667a0-98a1-69d4-e783-9185dc35fcc1  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
